title: Power-crazed white wannabe cop killed black shopper for using disabled parking spot
text:
Michael Drejka, left, has been jailed for 20 years for the murder of Markeis McGlockton, right, after confronting him for parking in a disabled space outside a convenience store (Pictures: AP/ABC News)

A power-hungry ‘wannabe cop’ was sentenced to 20 years jail for shooting an unarmed black shopper after he used a disabled parking space.

Circuit Judge Joseph Bulone jailed 49-year-old Michael Drejka on Thursday after branding him a ‘wannabe’ law enforcement officer and self-appointed ‘handicapped parking space monitor.’

Jurors found Drejka, of Clearwater in Florida, guilty of the manslaughter of Markeis McGlockton, 28, in August, just over a year after the July 2018 shooting.

Drejka confronted McGlockton’s girlfriend Britany Jacobs in July 2018 for parking in a disabled space at a Clearwater convenience store.

McGlockton had gone inside the store with his 5-year-old son to buy drinks.

Michael Drejka can be seen on the right, down on his knees and brandishing a gun moments before shooting Markeis McGlockton dead after his girlfriend used a disabled parking space (Picture: AP)

As the confrontation continued, a customer went into the store and alerted McGlockton.

Security video shows McGlockton leaving the store and shoving Drejka to the ground.

Seconds later, Drejka pulls out a handgun and shoots the McGlockton as he backs away.

The judge told the court he was shocked by the hypocrisy of Drejka, who drove up, illegally parked next to Jacobs’ car and then confronted her about parking illegally in a handicapped space.

He said: ‘He just seems to come out of nowhere, kind of like a superhero, to see that he enforces the handicapped parking spot’ Bulone said.

Jacobs paid tribute to her partner before the sentence was passed, saying: ‘There are no words to fully describe what his loss has done to our family.

‘Our youngest two children will never have memories of their daddy.’
description: Michael Drejka was jailed for 20 years on Thursday after parking illegally to confront - and shoot - Markeis McGlockton for using a disabled space
